title: David Bowie officially confirms new album Blackstar, with the first single getting a November release date - Music
text: Just over 24 hours after rumours of a new David Bowie album first broke, the iconic singer has confirmed the news via his official Facebook page.Which means that we can now officially start getting excited for Blackstar.(function(d, s, id) { var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0]; if (d.getElementById(id)) return; js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id; js.src = "//connect.facebook.net/en_GB/sdk.js#xfbml=1&version=v2.3"; fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);}(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));David Bowie 'Blackstar'It can now be confirmed that 'Blackstar' is the forthcoming single and album from David...Posted by David Bowie on Sunday, 25 October 2015In addition to confirming the album's release date on Bowie's birthday (January 8, 2016), the post also announced that the titular lead single 'Blackstar' will be available to fans a lot sooner - November 20, to be precise.The track was originally shared as the theme tune for Sky Atlantic drama The Last Panthers starring Samantha Morton and John Hurt.One thing it is important to note about Bowie's upcoming album, though, is that it is not part of his work on Lazarus, the musical based on the singer's 1976 film The Man Who Fell to Earth.
